data.text:
Screening log

EXCESSIVELY GEEKY EXPLANATION OF GRADES

10 — Year best contender and possible all-time favorite. Have watched the film repeatedly and it holds up to that.

9 — Annual top 10 contender, with no significant flaws. Highest grade a film can receive on first view.

8 — Warmly recommended and would happily watch again now. Sometimes a Top 10 contender with one major flaw.

7 — Solid. Recommended but would not be overwhelmed by grief if I were legally barred from ever seeing again.

6 — Recommended in net, but multiple significant flaws, or disappoints in some significant way.

5 — Mixed. Good points and bad points in about equal measure. Sometimes just one horrific, nails-on-blackboard flaw.

4 — Not recommended in net, but has multiple significant virtues or features that make me doubt my skeptical reaction.

3 — Little to recommend, usually has only basic competence going for it. Rarely doubt my negative reaction.

2 — A painful experience. Fundamentally misconceived by talented folk or hampered by basic incompetence.

1 — I couldn’t wait to leave the theater. No significant virtues or cause for enjoyment or productive thought.

0 — A film whose very existence is an offense to all that is good and right. Would happily burn the last existing copy.

To be perfectly honest, the grades 0-2 also are significantly affected by the wholly subjective “how much did this film piss me off” factor.
